event.title: settled in the wilderness of the southwest part of the Montcalm County in 1844

data.event: Greenville is named after its founder, John Green, who settled in the wilderness of the southwest part of the Montcalm County in 1844.

event.title: celebrates the Danish Festival every year on the third weekend of August

data.event: The newly formed Green's Village attracted many people of Danish origin who followed another early Danish settler's positive letters home regarding the area., Because of the town's heritage, Greenville celebrates the Danish Festival every year on the third weekend of August.
A post office was established on January 20, 1848, with Abel French as the first postmaster.
John Green had the village platted in 1853 and it was a station on the Detroit, Grand Rapids and Western Railroad.
Greenville incorporated as a village in 1867 and as a city in 1871.
Meijer corporation now operates stores throughout the Midwest.
